1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
a Naamathite, or inhabitant of Naamah

2.brief: a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
to be (causatively, make) right (in a moral or forensic sense)

3.brief: a brag or lie; also a liar
properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
to deride; by implication (as if imitating a foreigner) to speak unintelligibly
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, to wound; but only figuratively, to taunt or insult

4.brief: properly, something received, i.e. (mentally) instruction (whether on the part of the teacher or hearer); also (in an active and sinister sense) inveiglement
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

5.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

6.brief: properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
support or (by implication) ability, i.e. (direct) help, (in purpose) an undertaking, (intellectual) understanding

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to forget; figuratively, to neglect; causatively, to remit, remove

7.brief: properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

8.brief: the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

9.brief: the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, extent, i.e. height; also a measure; by implication, a vesture (as measured); also a carpet
roomy, in any (or every) direction, literally or figuratively
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

10.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to slide by, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, pass on, spring up, pierce or change
to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

11.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand

12.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to pierce; to be hollow, or (figuratively) foolish
(in a good sense) transport (with love), or (in a bad sense) stultify; to make cakes
properly, a young ass (as just broken to a load); hence an ass-colt
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage

13.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
near, with or among; often in general, to
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power

14.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)

15.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to stain; a blemish (physically or morally)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, to pour out (transitive or intransitive); by implication, to melt or cast as metal; by extension, to place firmly, to stiffen or grow hard
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

16.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male

17.brief: a light (i.e. window); dual double light, i.e. noon
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
life (as a fleeting portion of time); hence, the world (as transient)
to fly; also (by implication of dimness) to faint (from the darkness of swooning)
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

18.brief: figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
properly, to pry into; by implication, to delve, to explore
properly, a place of refuge; abstract, safety, both the fact (security) and the feeling (trust); often (adverb with or without preposition) safely
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)

19.brief: to crouch (on all four legs folded, like a recumbent animal); be implication, to recline, repose, brood, lurk, imbed
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to shudder with terror; hence, to fear; also to hasten (with anxiety)
properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

20.brief: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
a retreat (literally or figuratively); abstractly, a fleeing
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
a breathing out (of life), i.e. expiring
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
